script: Ever wonder how computers understand words? Think of words as points on a map—closer words mean similar meanings. For example, 'king' and 'queen' are near each other, but far from 'banana.' This is called vector embeddings—a math trick that turns words into numbers to show their relationships. Why does it matter? It powers search engines, translations, and even chatbots! So next time you type a question, remember—words are just coordinates in a hidden semantic world.
